short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Makes all HTML tables sortable and searchable.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This Chrome extension enhances all tables on any web page you visit, making it easier to sort and search through data. It adds sorting functionality to table columns and a search bar above each table for filtering rows based on content.

Features:

Sortable Columns: Click on any column header to sort the table data in ascending or descending order. This makes it easy to organize information alphabetically or numerically.
Search Bar: A search bar is added above each table, allowing you to quickly filter rows by typing keywords. Only rows that match your search will be displayed, making it easy to find specific data.
Toggle Button: The extension includes a toggle button to enable or disable the sortable and searchable features. By default, these features are enabled, but you can turn them off if needed.

How It Works:

Sorting: Click on a column header to sort the rows of the table based on the data in that column. Clicking again reverses the order.
Searching: Use the search bar above the table to filter rows. As you type, only the rows containing your search terms will be visible.
Toggle: Use the toggle button in the extension's popup menu to enable or disable the sortable and searchable features.
